p: Influenza A viruses (IAVs) circulate globally and, based on WHO estimates, annual epidemics of influenza result in ~1 billion infections, 3–5 million cases of severe illness, and 300 000–500 000 deaths. The severity of pandemic influenza depends on multiple factors, such as the virulence of the pandemic virus strain and the level of pre-existing immunity in the population. The discovery of two novel bat influenza viruses, H17N10 and H18N11 ( Table 1 ) [ 1., 2., 3.] has raised several questions about the evolution, host range, tropism, and transmission potential of these viruses.
